description: A traditional technique used in desert regions to harvest rainwater by creating structures that spread water across agricultural land, allowing moisture to seep into the soil and recharge it, supporting crop cultivation even in dry climates.
principles: Support for crop cultivation in arid conditions
steps: Identify suitable land slopes for water harvesting.
Construct barriers or channels to direct rainwater.
Allow water to spread across the land to enhance soil moisture.
Monitor soil moisture levels to ensure effectiveness.
risks: Erosion of soil if not properly managed
Potential for waterlogging if barriers are too high
